definition: Heaven never bars one's way (idiom); don't despair and you will find a way through./Never give up hope./Never say die.
pinyin: tian1 wu2 jue2 ren2 zhi1 lu4

definition: day/sky/heaven
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Lu
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind

sentences.english: Days were absolutely no way is the way out of the step-by-step.
sentences.chinese: 天无绝人之路，路是一步一步走出来的。

definition: lit. When we get to the mountain, there'll be a way through. (idiom)/fig. Everything will turn out for the best./Let's worry about it when it happens./It will be all right on the night./cf couplet 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: che1 dao4 shan1 qian2 bi4 you3 lu4

definition: one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
lit. when the boat gets to the pier-head, it will go straight with the current (proverb)/fig. everything will be all right/cf 車到山前必有路，船到橋頭自然直|车到山前必有路，船到桥头自然直
pinyin: chuan2 dao4 qiao2 tou2 zi4 ran2 zhi2

definition: lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: a really determined person will find a solution (idiom); where there's a will, there's a way
pinyin: you3 zhi4 zhe3 shi4 jing4 cheng2

definition: Heaven will not disappoint the person who tries (idiom). If you try hard, you're bound to succeed eventually.
pinyin: Huang2 tian1 bu4 fu4 ku3 xin1 ren2

definition: Heaven helps the worthy (idiom)
pinyin: ji2 ren2 zi4 you3 tian1 xiang4

definition: to just escape from calamity
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to lose heart/to be discouraged
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
